column4: 43 le Loi Street, Hội An 51000 Việt Nam
column6:
I stumbled upon this shop as I was having coffee next door. Given the area (Ancient Town) is reputable, and Vietnam tailors/seamstresses are known for great work, I assumed that this shop was decent. That was MISTAKE #1.

I was hunting for a casual dress for my brothers beach wedding that is approaching in Thailand. After discussing with the woman (who seemed to be in charge that day). The woman constantly says “why not”). She suggested that she had something great in mind...exactly what I wanted but she quoted me for $80 USD. I quickly explained that $50 USD was my budget. I showed her a picture of what I wanted and the woman obliged. We then went on discussing the color. I hemmed and hawed about which shade of blue to go with. Another woman who was shopping at the same time as me, started recommended things to me and I got highly distracted. The “Why Not” lady wrote up my receipt as I was in conversation. She charged me 1,560,000 VND ($78 USD). MISTAKE #2.
NOBODY MAKES YOU PAY IN FULL UP FRONT. Standard is 20% until you pick up your item(s). Again, I was distracted by not being familiar using Dong, and the other shopper who encouraged me to pay in VND. I realize, shame on me.
I, excitedly, went to pick up my dress the next day. The Why Not lady was less than interested in me when I approached (of course because she already way OVERCHARGED me and had my $ in full). She led me to a dingy dark dirty corner of the shop where she pointed to the dress folded over. As soon as seeing it, I knew this was not the style of anything I wanted to wear. When I tried it on I noticed
1) the material buckled in the wrong spots.
2) the dress was so ill fitted.

When I explained that I was upset about the fact that the dress didn’t look ANYTHING like what we had discussed....The Why Not Woman cared less. She chewed her peanuts and never once tried to rectify the situation.
I later inspected the details of the dress (when I was out of that dark space). I noticed
1) white thread used for the blue dress
2) a sea green zipper was used for the back and was exposed
3) holes were everywhere where the seams were undone.

This whole experience was just awful.
When I went back to the shop later in the evening, I tried talking to the Why Not lady, pleading to get some money back (willing to leave the dress with her). I explained that I felt ripped off. I gave her cash in VND but she charged me more than what was agreed upon. She was so rude to me and basically got a huge attitude and told me she gave me exactly what I asked for. She yelled and she had a nasty look on her face while my mother, brother, and son stood there with me.
After walking away, I spoke with another shop owner in the area and that’s when we looked up Thien Thanh on TripAdvisor. We were surprised this place could even afford to be in such a highly regarded are of Hoi An. It was then that we realized they prey on tourists but do not care about the people or the workmanship, not to mention customer service.
I am ashamed that I didn’t do my due diligence first and that I didn’t see the red flags, but this woman was awful for tricking me and basically stealing from me and being uber rude to boot.
Below is the dress that I asked for and then you’ll see a comparison of what I was given along with the flaws.

column4: 66 Bạch Đằng, Hội An 560000 Việt Nam
column6:
Downstairs is a retail store that sells colorful masks with Vietnamese designs and upstairs is a performance arts theater that woos tourists by the bus load.
We saw a few busloads of them trudge in to go upstairs as our kids worked on their own masks.

The store has the Master of the craft and his 'under study'. They give you tips and guidance on theme colors and brush techniques and then let you go. Mind you, their English language skills are down at the bottom.

There is an occasional look over the shoulder but to the greater extent you're in your own with your creation.

It doesn't take very long ... Maybe an hour or less of painting (and you could walk away and come back after the drying is done) and you would come out with something unique from Hoi An to take home.
And the whole thing is at a very reasonable price.

column6:
Whilst on holiday, I went in and ordered 2 suits, 1 grey and one blue. As I had hand luggage only, they agreed to post them.
When I recieved them, the blue suit had the trousers in a totally different material to the jacket and waistcoat. After many emails, they agreed to remake them and send the new trousers. I finally recieved them about a month ago but they are about 3 inches shorter than the grey pair from which they were supposed to take the measurements. They now do not reply to my emails.
Disgraceful service.
Avoid at all costs.

column4: 35 Bis - 45, Le Thanh Ton Street, District 1, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh 70000 Việt Nam
column6:
Đã hơn mười năm tính từ tháng 6/2005 đến nay, ngày mà TT/TM Parkson Sàigòn Tourist Plaza chính thức khai trương tại số 35 - 45 đường Lê Thánh Tôn và góc Đồng Khởi, Q.1 (TpHCM), một khu đất vàng đắc địa giữa lòng một TP phồn thịnh, lúc đó Parkson mau chóng trở thành một Trung tâm mua sắm cao cấp, sang trọng được khách hàng trong ngoài nước nhộn nhịp lui tới, không chỉ thích đến mua sắm thỏa thuê, mà còn tới chốn này để thưởng thức những món ăn ngon miệng quen thuộc của các nhà hàng có tiếng. Bắt nhịp, hệ thống thương mại Parkson triển khai thêm một vài Trung tâm mua sắm hoành tráng khác tại Q. 7 và Q. 5, các thương hiệu thời trang danh giá như : Lancôme, Armani, Calvin Klein, Escada, Lauder, DKNY, Lancel, Timberland, Tommy Hilfiger ..... đua nhau chen chân góp mặt tại các TT/TM Parkson uy danh này.
Mãi tới khoảng từ năm 2010, khi gã khổng lồ Vincom Center B và A (nay đổi tên là Union Square) xuất đầu lộ diện, thì Parkson bỗng trở thành người hàng xóm yếu thế bất đắc dĩ, từ hình thức đến nội dung, đấy là chưa nói tới một số ông lớn khác trong làng mua sắm như : Diamond Plaza. Sàigòn Centre ....... cho đến bây giờ, chỉ mỗi TT/TM Parkson Sàigòn Tourist Plaza tại Lê Thánh Tôn là còn trụ lại được trên thị trường mua sắm đầy thách thức, đua tranh này.

column6:
My wife and I met the family on our first night in Hoi An. We popped in for some water at their E Mart & fell in love with them and their beautiful family.
We had the intention of getting shoes made later on that week but from looking at their products and samples and just having a chat we had a great feeling.
I first purchased some brogues and the next day they were ready and exactly what I had picked out.
We went on to order more sandals & shoes. Mine were a little tight and my wife's needed minimal adjustment with the straps around the toes but it was no bother, by the following day they were ready for pick up and exactly what we had shown from our pictures.
I highly recommend them and their beautiful craftsmanship. You won't be disappointed.

column4: 505 Đường Minh Khai Tầng 2 trung tâm thương mại V+, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội 10000 Việt Nam
column6:
Good and fair price.
I was looking for a tailor who can create a woman suit, and not many are doing it. I have found the address of this shop on the internet. It is not in the city centre but you can take a taxi to get there (approx. 3$ from old quater).
They do not speak English at all but the staff have been really friendly and opened google translate on her phone to communicate with me. We have been able to discuss about the suit, the fabric, the delay etc with google translate and gestures, and it worked pretty well. It is also good to have a picture of what you want, it helps.
In 4 days the suit was done, and when I picked it up they even adjust the length of my sleeves as it was too short from my opinion.
They are not this kind of tailor who wants to swindle tourists so it is appreciated.

column6:
Với một Thành phố vô cùng năng động, nhộn nhịp, sung túc và đáng sống như TpHCM thì việc hiếm hoi có được một cửa hàng Bacchus Corner Wines & Spirits chuyên cung ứng, phân phối đủ các mặt hàng về rượu khai vị, rượu mùi, rượu mạnh nhập khẩu từ các nước phương Tây và cả rượu Sake truyền thống của đất nước "Mặt trời mọc", đảm bảo chất lượng, mang nhãn hiệu quốc tế nổi tiếng trên khắp thế giới như : San Pedro, Zonin, Chanson, Camus........ là vô cùng hợp lý và phù hợp.
Không chỉ khách du lịch vãng lai, khách hàng người địa phương sành điệu, ưa thích các loại bia ngoại, rượu vang, rượu mạnh, rượu mùi để xử dụng hay mua biếu làm quà tặng, chúng tôi cũng phải "lóa mắt" khi bước chân vào cửa hàng rượu ngoại sang trọng này, khi thấy có cả ngàn chai rượu các loại nhãn mác được bày biện, trưng bày khéo léo trên nhiều dãy hàng kệ môt cách gọn gàng, bắt mắt. gồm các loại rượu vang, rượu mùi, rượu mạnh nổi tiếng cỡ như : Cheval Noir, Amarula Cream Liquour, Jack Daniel's, Skyy 90, Johnny Walker Gold ...... giá cũng phải trên dưới vài ba triệu/một chai tùy theo loại hay dung tích lớn nhỏ.
Ngoài việc bán buôn cung cấp, phân phối đủ loại mặt hàng về rượu bia ngoại nhập, hệ thống cửa hàng Bacchus Corner còn phục vụ, chăm sóc khách hàng qua những dịch vụ để khách dùng thử, thưởng thức mặt hàng mới về rượu, chúng tôi cảm thấy rất hài lòng về đội ngũ tiếp tân, NV phục vụ tỏ ra vô cùng chuyên nghiệp, lịch sự và mến khách.

column6:
数件並びのチョコレートショップにお土産を買いに行った帰りに目についたので入ってみました。
入ると、いらっしゃいませと日本語で声をかけられてビックリ、その後もかなり流暢な日本語で接客、２階や別の売り場に行っても日本語の上手なスタッフの方々が。
お菓子系のお土産は他と同じか少し安い。ベトナムのパロディTシャツはハン市場では240,000ドンと言われた物が 値切らなくて100,000ドン 5枚買うと10%offに。
2階にはナイロンバンドのバックや雑貨など、カラフルな物が多数。
買い物終えて他の店を見てから、買い忘れた物があったので再来店したら、再来店の方は無条件で全て5%offにしてもらえた。
良心的な値段での販売と日本語での接客で安心して良いお土産を買うことがでしました。
ベトナムの通貨が足りなくなった時は、ドルや日本円でも買い物可能と説明がありました。
いちいち値段交渉が面倒だと感じる方はオススメです。

column7: Số 14 trên 47 Mua sắm ở Huế

column6:
Trầm Tuệ là một nơi hoàn hảo để tĩnh tâm, thưởng trà. Mình được mời đến Trầm Tuệ chơi do đi cùng bạn là một người làm trong Trầm Tuệ. Điều đầu tiên mình cảm nhận được là sự bình yên, thư thái, không gian ngập tràn màu xanh của cây cỏ, có tiếng nước chảy róc rách, và tiếng chuông gió vang vang. Quả thực được làm việc trong không gian này hàng ngày là một điều tuyệt vời.

Cơm chay ở Trầm Tuệ nấu rất ngon, chấm 10 sao luôn, mình đã được thưởng thức 2-3 lần, lần nào cũng thấy ngon, cách mọi người chuẩn bị món ăn cũng rất tỉ mỉ, chu đáo.

Sống chậm, là phong cách của mọi người ở đây, mặc dù ai làm việc cũng chăm chỉ nhưng mọi người chú tâm làm việc, và làm gì cũng hết lòng. Cũng vì là doanh nghiệp Phật tử nên ai ở đây cũng dễ thương hết. Cảm giác ấm áp như một gia đình. Hôm mình đi có mang theo bé nhà mình mới 4 tháng, các cô chú còn chủ động trông em bé giùm để mình ăn trước.

Đến một lần là chắc chắn muốn quay trở lại :)

column6: Был в марте 2019 года. Хотел взять пуэр (да, это не Китай, но всё же близко), причём сырой, то есть шен. Продавец, русский, показал несколько вариантов в блинах и кирпичах. Приглашал попробовать, но из-за экскурсий в нужное время подойти не удалось. Перед отъездом зашёл и взял один блин 357 гр. и один кирпичик 250 гр. Уже вернувшись, попытался по обёрткам определить, как называется купленный чай. В результате выяснилось, что и тот и другой оказались ферментированными, то есть шу пуэрами. Я конечно, в китайских чаях ещё новичок, но зачем же так явно говорить неправду? Чай-то я выпью, а вот отношение к покупателям не радует. За большой выбор чая и кофе балл оценки добавлю, но больше не за что...

Je suis tellement content d’être venu ici pour me faire un costard, chemise et des pantalons car c’était absolument fantastique avec un retour encore mieux que souhaite et pour un prix très compétitifs face aux autres tailleurs de la ville. On m’a donné des précieux conseil (le tout en anglais) et j’étais à chaque fois bien conseillé pour m’aider dans mon choix. Encore un grand merci pour vos services 🥰😍

column6: We ordered 2 dresses each, the dresses came to roughly £50 each. We were expecting a lot as we had chosen simple designs and were promised high quality. The service was very fast but we left feeling a little disappointed. One of the dresses was perfect but it’s was a simple blue linen dress and not much could go wrong. The second dress was a more expensive fabric and didn’t fit me well at all, at first it drowned me and then when I asked for it to be tigher they did too much so that the fabric pulled and looked unflattering. They actually suggested I lost weight to fit in to it. Not really the idea of tailoring as the dress was suppose to fit my body not the other way around. Over all of you going to go here pick a simple and safe but generally wouldn’t recommend.

column4: 77 Hàng Gai Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000 Việt Nam
column6:
I didn't come to Hanoi planning to buy a suit. I had a couple of hours to kill and I figured it wouldn't hurt to get a few quotes. Duc Loi was the first place I checked out. Not only was their English excellent, but they were also friendly, honest, and patient. After realizing how affordable the suits were, I decided that I would quickly visit three other places in the neighbourhood to compare.

I ultimately decided to settle on Duc Loi. I couldn't find fabrics that I liked at the other locations. As well, they were not nearly as friendly or patient as the staff at Duc Loi. I ended buying two 2-piece suits and 1 tailored shirt.

I was able to get the suits made in under 72hrs! I ordered the suits around 3:30PM and the owner opened her shop at 9:00PM that evening just so that I could come back for my first fitting.

The suits fit perfectly. The staff are familiar with the most up-to-date styles for men's suits - what's appropriately fancy and what's gimmicky - and gave excellent advice. If you're planning to get a tailored suit, make sure you do your research beforehand (e.g. # of vents, single breasted or double breasted, stitching, extra pockets, lapel styles). I made the mistake of not preparing beforehand and had to google it on the spot. They were able to accommodate all of my additional requests: boutonniere hole, extra ticket pockets, extra internal pockets, etc. The shirt fit a bit looser than I was used to, but it afforded more mobility and comfort.

Overall, I highly recommend the store for their price, service, speed, and quality.

When I saw the silk shop I asked my husband to wait while I explored the silk shop. The ladies were welcoming and spoke some English. I saw a lovely grey silk sleeveless dress. I have had so many complements. I wish I'd bought every colour. I am uncertain if there is an opportunity for that store to ship. I would order from them.

column6:
Small and understating storefront could be misleading to foreigners' eyes, but, this is a hard-to-find truly professional custom picture framer. I was so glad to discover this shop while trying to make and repair a half dozen frames for prints, drawings, diploma, and art object. Unlike most framers in Saigon, the owner has great artistic eyes and gives you excellent advice (in English!) for the choice of frame type, dimension, depth, and color. All frames came up with impressive quality. Price is reasonable, too. Only downside is delivery time. It takes 1 week or 2 -- not very convenient to short stay travelers.

A nice surprise was in the back of the order sheet, There was a clear statement of 'rule of engagements.' In Vietnam, everything is opaque and run by quick fix mentality, which leads to inevitable surprises. it is very rare to see responsibilities are stated clearly upfront on both customers and the store. It shows the professionalism of the store owner.

column6: My husband saw the shirts at this shop as we passed by and liked the fabrics. The lady was very friendly and not pushy - a rarity in Vietnamese tailor shops. We had already been to two fancy big tailor shops in Hoi An for suits for my husband and myself (see other reviews) and weren't really in the mood, but the fabrics were nice - and most importantly the price for 3 shirts was under $50. So we thought "what the heck - give them a try". The shirts turned out GREAT! When we stopped by for a fitting and a few alterations were needed - not a problem - when we came back - the shirts were perfect - seriously! The arms were not too tight but very well fit, the length of hem and sleeves were well done and all in 24 hrs with a smile. I would definitely recommend this shop - I have no doubt they would do an excellent job on any piece of clothing - and probably for much less than the other places we went too!

column6: I traveled with my disabled mother and had bought my tickets 6 months earlier to my travels to secure a “proper scheduled itinerary” based on my timeline. At the day of the event, I received a call from the tour agency telling me that the show I had booked was sold out (meaning that they misused my money funds for something else at the time) and that if I wanted ti se the show it would be the show earlier (20 minutes before the show began). Vietnam is heavy on traffic and attending earlier caused disruption and was disrespectful. Not only that, but The travel agent hung her phone twice on me and I had to Venture to see if I could attend the show I wanted to presence with my mother. The travel agent was disrespectful, unprofessional, and lied to us. Terrible service.

column6:
It's surprising that there aren't many reviews of this shop, because we found it to be the best place to purchase for souvenirs in the beautiful town of Sapa. 🥰

Tucked away in a nondescript street, this is a hidden gem in Sapa with beautifully handcrafted souvenirs at prices cheaper than the stalls at the night markets and other stores outside. The quality is also far more superior and there isn't much need to haggle for prices over here, which made our shopping experience all the more pleasant.

We bought several table runners and a few stuffed animals at very good prices. The table runners are made by the two lady owners of the shop and the workmanship is excellent. The shopkeeper is a very kind lady who even helped us flag a cab at a cheaper fare as the driver wanted to charge us extra to travel to Cat Cat Village (seeing that we are foreigners).

Do visit here if you ever come to Sapa! 😆

16:00頃に到着したのですが、お店の電気が消えている…
「まさか臨時休業！？」と思いながら、2階の入り口に上がると扉が開きました。
入店する電気をつけてくれました。空調は入っておらず、かなり暑かったです。

店内はとても広く、デザインもトラディッショナルな雰囲気なものから、現代風のものまで揃っていてかなり悩みました。
値段もそこまで高くないので、ここに来れば何か欲しいものが見つかると思います。
購入品もかわいいかごバッグに入れてくれます。
ただ店員さんはあまり親切でなはく、梱包も適当なので、持ち帰りのときは気を付けた方が良いと思います。
店内の写真撮影は禁止のため、購入した商品だけ撮影させてもらいました。

現金のみ

column6: I found this tailor while walking around my hotel in District 1. There are loads of tailors in the area but I find the quality to be hit-or-miss. I've had some suits done by Byfas some years ago but this time I just needed to get a few pants done and the price they quoted me was really expensive (USD $120 for a copy of the pair I brought). I am so glad I found Sakura Silk as they made 2 excellent pants for me for about 1/4 the price. Ms. Quyen was my main contact and she is lovely. They even tried to fix a pair of pants of mine that had a hole in it (my copy pair and the reason i needed some new ones) but the pattern was very unique. She told me they would hold onto them for a future visit. When I picked them up 2 days later, I had a delightful conversation with Ms. Nga who is one of the staff there. I was delighted with the pant quality and workmanship (and price!). I will definitely use them again on my next visit to HCMC.

column6: Я очень люблю этот отель,настолько он милый,чистый ,ухоженный.Небольшой ,но очень уютный..В этот раз мы жили в бунгало-это так здорово.Во-первых уединенно,вокруг зелень,цветы,красотааа.Всё в шаговой доступности-завтрак,море,басейн..Мы в этот раз не ездили особо по экскурсиям,и я честно говоря,думала что будет скучно..Но время пролетело так быстро,а уезжать после 11 дней все равно не хотелось..Погода была чудная,пляж чистый(чего не скажешь про другие пляжи рядом)..Лежаков куча(а народу много было)..И самое приятное-на нашей терраске у бунгало -мы лежали на лежаках ,попивали кофе,ели фрукты,наслаждались уединением и джунглями и шумом моря..(комаров нет,вай фай есть)))Конечно море с волнами,увы,но мы таки купались)))Кафешек за пределами отеля -море,чудесное мороженое делали на улице-ммм..Самый прекрасный отдых был в Бамбу))..Готова приехать туда и третий раз..Появилось развлечение-вечерний ужин с дискотекой-очень классно поют вживую-респект...ЧЕГО БЫ Я НЕ ДЕЛАЛА -это не повелась бы на призыв Анекс тура уехать в Далат-Ничанг с выездом-ночевкой в Ничанге..Там заселили на отшибе среди строек-до города ехать(отель Орбит),пляж -идти 10 мин,кругом грязища на пляже-Анапа отдыхает...В общем,могли бы хоть в самом городе поселить..

column1: Cho Dan Sinh (Hardware stores, army surplus, odds and ends)
column4: intersection of Yersin and Phan van Truong, District 1, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh 70000 Việt Nam
column6:
Trước năm 1950, mảnh đất rộng 5.000 mét vuông của chợ Dân Sinh được vây quanh bởi 4 con đường Yersin, Nguyễn Công Trứ, Nguyễn Thái Bình và Ký Con thuộc Q. 1 (TpHCM) là khu cờ bạc, chơi bời lừng tiếng có tên là Kim Chung, sau 1954 chốn ăn chơi sa đọa này bị xóa sổ và trở thành Khu Dân Sinh rồi chợ trời Dân Sinh, chuyên mua bán đồ lạc-xoong, kể cả những món hàng "chà đồ nhôm" có giá trị được trao tay, mua đi bán lại cũng có mặt trên các sạp quán tại đây.
Vào thập niên 70 -80, chợ Dân Sinh có Ban Quản Lý, chợ được sắp xếp lại cho có nề nếp, quy củ và an ninh hơn. Chợ Dân Sinh hoàn toàn thay đổi bộ mặt khi được bổ sung nhiều mặt hàng kinh doanh mới như : đồ kim khi điện máy, phu kiện cơ khí nhỏ lẻ, phụ tùng xe hơi, xe gắn máy, áo quần cũ mới, vật dụng đồ nghề cũ kể cả quân trang, quân dụng các loại ........... thậm chí, nhiều món hàng khó có thể tìm thấy trên thị trường, thì khách hàng có thể tìm mua tại khu chợ Dân Sinh này.
Dạo quanh chợ Dân Sinh, ta có thể bắt gặp không ít khách du lịch nước ngoài, Việt kiều đi sưu tầm đồ lưu niệm, đồ cổ xưa của đồng tiền, tem, tranh ảnh.........Đối với người dân TP hay du khách đủ mọi quốc tịch, chợ Dân Sinh là một địa điểm mà nhiều người thích thú tìm đến như một nơi tập hợp được nhiều món hàng lưu niệm, đồ cổ xưa có giá trị của một thời đã qua đối với cá nhân họ.
column7: Số 211 trên 522 Mua sắm ở Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh

column6:
We are traveling with a transfer stop. So we have 3 opportunities to shop our duty free quota.
If we shop at Sasco, we have to carry what we buy. So, shop in Ho Chi Minh and send in check in luggage? Buy on transfer stop, or order online and pick up at destination, no carrying or waiting in line needed.

Price and selection would be a key here, it seems
But Sasco do not have a webpage showing anything except brands.
And price, availability etc?
Company policy NOT to inform.
Online, phone, mail

Nothing

Reason? They can not, are not able to etc.

Then, after 3 days, 5 phone calls and a number out of service, the real reason.

Company policy. Come here and buy or do not buy.
This makes sure you can not compare prices, have time to think etc.
Classic scam.
Calling this policy serving costumers is a joke
.
SASCO Shop satisfies the ultimate needs of them selves, to scam you for money before departure.

Avoid.
Will update with price comparison for fairness if we have time.

Incidentally, a friend who went to Vietnam to work in combination with tourism bought me a Vietnamese filter bag weasel coffee of the HatA Cafe brand, its taste surprised me. The coffee has a subtle, deep seductive aroma, a pure and mild bitter taste, ecstatic with a sweet taste in the throat that will make me completely immersed in a legendary taste. Again subtly with a hint of Chocolate and vanilla giving me an experience that is not only refined and pure, but also leaves an unforgettable mark with its characteristic intense flavor. In particular, the delicious and convenient filter bag coffee is suitable for my busy work. How wonderful.

column6: Established in 1993, Mai Gallery is the first private gallery in Hanoi, Vietnam. Over more than a decade, Mai Gallery has cemented its reputation as a gallery successfully promoting Vietnamese Artists, and bringing them to international recognition. A visit to Mai Gallery will give you an opportunity to admire works by leading artists of Vietnam. It is a focal poin for people to develop and share their knowledge of the art and culture of Vietnam. Mai Gallery particularly relishes exhibiting the talents of young and emerging artists. With its extensive collection of art, Mai Gallery is always ready to provide art lovers with the best works of the best artists in Vietnam. Word has quickly spread that Mai Gallery is the place for art lovers.

column6: I was sitting with my dad having egg coffee when I realized his wallet was falling apart... I decided it was time to do something about that (since he would have continued that way indefinitely), and seeing as Christmas was around the corner, the timing couldn't have been better to find Virgo! I looked at their styles online and requested a custom wallet (the one with the wolf on the front). The woman at the counter (I'm sorry, I forgot your name!!) gave me a couple options (including printing his name on the inside). I couldn't have been happier with the service and quality of the product. I hesitate to say this shop is expensive because the value is so good. Yes, you might pay more than another shop, but I don't think you'd find the same quality elsewhere. The stitching is top notch, the leather is great, there are lot of little touches that make it the perfect place if you want something semi-bespoke. I'm already looking forward to seeing my dad's wallet for years to come!

We visited this shop in June 15 and made a series of purchases of both shoes and other leather goods. All prices were initially quoted in USD, however they are quite happy to quote/charge in VND also. The items produced were of a high standard and neither of us has any complaints about the quality. The girls were extremely friendly and accommodating to deal with - nothing was too difficult. In partricular my wife was able to have a pair of her favourite running shoes copied in leather which fitted her as though they were the old nicely stretched pair!
I bought a selection of sandals as well as a leather cover for my Ipad. All the items were manufactured in a very reasonable time with little fuss. I was even presented with a little thank you gift - a cover for my Iphone at no cost!
I highly recommend this shop to anyone travelling to Hoi An who is looking for high quality leather goods at a very reasonable price.

column6:
Wir waren für 15 Tage in Mui Nee, und hatten uns von den positiven Bewertungen beeinflussen lassen.
Herr Thinh ist ein sehr sympathischer Mann der auch gut deutsch spricht.
Meine Frau und ich wollen uns jeweils eine Sonnenbrille und eine normale Brille als Gleitsicht herstellen lassen.
Schnell hatten wir uns für passende Gestelle entschieden, wir einigten uns für die 4 Brillen auf einen Preis von 475€.
Nach nur 2 Tagen waren die normalen Brillen fertig, die wir nun 3 Tage testen konnten. Wir hatten von Anfang an ein komisches Gefühl, aber bei einer neuen Brille kann sowas schon mal sein.
Dieses Gefühl nahm aber auch nach 3 Tagen nicht ab. Ich stellte fest, dass ich nicht in verschiedenen Positionen lesen konnte. Bei meiner Frau wars so, dass sie zwar lesen konnte, aber die Brille nicht ordentlich zentriert war und Sie dadurch immer Schwindelgefühle hatte. Nach 3 weiteren Tagen kamen die Sonnenbrillen an, damit hatten wir genau die selben Probleme, also Qualität gleich 0%.
Man muss Herrn Thinh zugute halten, dass es ihm Leid tat, und er uns bat Ihm noch eine Change zu geben. Was wir leider verneinten, da alle 4 Brillen nicht zu gebrauchen waren.
Durch unsere persöhnliche Erfahrung würden wir den Kauf von Gleitsichtbrillen in Vietnam abraten.
column7: Số 12 trên 17 Mua sắm ở Phan Thiết

column6: I needed a haircut as my curly, long hair did not go well in the heat and humidity of Vietnam. Was recommended to this barbershop by my Airbnb host, so lucky I was. Went in there, the boys were aghast at my decision and kept asking "Are you sure ?". Yes, I want a Vietnamese style cut. Had shampoo and scalp massage first (included) then Minh Viet went to work, he is a master at his craft. An added bonus, he is an amateur photographer and took a "studio" shot which he sent me later. An all-round fun and wonderful experience. If you need a haircut in Hanoi, DON'T go anywhere else....

column6: お店の雰囲気もスタッフも良かったのですが、こちらで買ったオーガニックのダラットコーヒー（アラビカ種、挽いてない豆タイプ、５００ｇ入り）を買ってきて自宅で飲んでみたら、あまりに酸っぱくてびっくり！ふだんからいろいろな国のフェアトレードコーヒーを飲んでいて、多少の酸味はおいしさのうちと思うほうなのですが、それでもこれほど強烈な酸味と、ほかの味や香りがほとんどしないコーヒーは初めてでした。コーヒー豆の色も薄く、何か製造や保存の過程（表示を信じれば、賞味期限までは１年以上あるのですが）で問題があったのかなと思いましたが、詳しいことはわかりません。もし豆が酸化していたら体に悪いので、せっかく大袋で買ったのに残念ですが、もう飲まないことにしました・・。フェアトレードという名前に安易に飛びついてしまい、反省しています。

column6:
Bếp Phương Đông (hay Nội Thất Phương Đông) - chuyên nhập khẩu các thiết bị nhà bếp và phòng tắm chính hãng, uy tín, giá rẻ trong và ngoài nước.

Bếp Phương Đông tự hào là đơn vị cung cấp các sản phẩm bếp từ, máy hút mùi, máy rửa bát, bồn tắm, phòng xông hơi, chậu vòi, .... giá rẻ, đáng tin cậy, vượt trội về chất lượng, đáp ứng mọi nhu cầu của khách hàng về mẫu mã, kiểu dáng, xuất xứ: Đức, Tây Ban Nha, Italya, Thái Lan, Malaysia và Trung Quốc. Đến với chúng tôi, bạn chắc chắn sẽ hài lòng về không gian sống của mình.

Er zijn heel veel kledingsshops voor maatkledij in Hoi An.
Een bekwame verkoopster wist ons te strikken vooraleer we andere shops hadden bezocht maar we zijn uitermate tevreden met het resultaat en de prijs.
Van de prijs kan je ongeveer 15 a 20% afdoen en dan zit je wel goed. Het product is topkwaliteit en zeer fijn afgewerkt.
Ik heb een 3-delig maatpak gekocht en dit had een perfecte pasvorm, had het niet zo goed verwacht. Bijkomend heeft de vriendin kleedjes uitgekozen uit nieuwe trendy kledingsboeken die dan volledig worden nagemaakt en ook deze vielen goed uit zodat we verdere bestellingen hebben gedaan.
Er is veel keuze in kleuren en tekeningen, alsook in kwaliteit van de stof. Kies voor de goede kwaliteit.
Het adres is nr 263 ipv 269

column4: 02 Hoa Lư Lê Đại Hành, Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội 100000 Việt Nam
column6: This silk is prepared with the treatment traditionally reserved for a particular era of Vietnamese emperors. It’s hand washed and sun-dried only during the early morning hours to prevent fading and saturate the silk in a special solution of black dye every day for 20 days in a row which gives the treated silk the look & drape of black leather that’s water-repellent & sun-fading resistant. Hahnsilk is the only establishment in the world that produces this treatment of silk which it fashions into classic & contemporary designs of dresses, blouses, pants, coats & capes that can be custom-fitted. The beauty of this one-of-a-kind silk fabric, once reserved only for Vietnamese emperors, is truly extraordinary, and can only be found at Hahnsilk at prices that will be appreciated by purveyors & connoisseurs of fine silk around the world.

column6:
There are 2 outlets of Sapa Hemp – main store at Cau May Street and another store at the basement of Sun Plaza, same building as La Coupole Sapa where we stayed.

During my first trip to Sapa in May 2019, we spotted this shop at Sun Plaza and bought the cushion and pillow cases. At our 2nd trip in Dec 2019, we went to the main store, and bought 2 pcs of table runner and 2 coasters.

This is the most expensive gift shop in Sapa. I even heard a tourist exclaimed ~ wow wow wow wow wow ~ after asking the price. And they do not offer a single cent of discount!

Albeit pricey, we did not hesitate to buy what we loved, and you can be sure of getting the most luxurious and high quality products.

Especially the pieces with red colored hemp – it feels so smooth and luxurious, it will surely wow your visitors at home. We shipped a piece of the table runner to the U.S., and my mother-in-law was very impressed with the quality.

If you would like something less expensive but good quality, check out Ahn Duc Shop which I also bought some pieces from there.

https://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/Attraction_Review-g311304-d19801108-Reviews-Anh_Duc_Shop-Sapa_Lao_Cai_Province.html

column4: 64 Quảng An Tây Hồ, Hà Nội 100000 Việt Nam
column6: For an emotional & cultural connection to the next item of clothing you buy, visit Kiomet109. From planting the seeds with women from the ethnic communities, to returning 3 months later to harvest the plants, every part of the process of making a Kilomet109 item of clothing is done by hand. Once plants are harvested the ethnic women then spin the silk or spin and weave the cotton. The materials are then dyed with indigo (another plant) or with dyes from other plants, according to secret recipes passed down by women in families, through the generations. Lots on the internet about this amazing home grown Hanoi business who has even featured in Harpers Bazaar. Great shop in Tay Ho & great story about an amazing local business with a huge social impact.

column6:
Eiskaffe mit Fin; ist ein hohes Glas mit Eiswürfel dazu ein tiefes Glas mit wenig Kondensmilch und darauf ein Alufilter gefüllt mit Kaffe aus der Mühle (Arrabica/Mocca eine köstliche Bohne) der langsam ins Glas tropft ca. 5 - 10 Min. Wichtig das hohe Glas nur vom geschmolzenen Eiswasser trennen,
anschliessend das tiefe Glas mit frischem heissen Kaffe und der Kondensmilch vermengen und über das hohe Glas mit den Eiswürfel giessen.
Wow Herz was willst du mehr. Tipp mit wenig Kondensmilch bestellen (it,it,it sua)
Auch frisch gepresste Fruchtsäfte, Smootis oder ein Fruchtsalat.

Ein hoch genuss

Adresse. 97 Tran Hung Dao, TT Duong Dong Phu Quoc Tel: 03456666.01

column6:
Este Boutique in Tam Coc

After dinner, we walked back to our hotel some 500 meters away when I noticed some unique items in one of the shops. If you walk by you would not even give it a second look as it looks as one of the outlets there.

However after entering, you would notice immediately that the items that they had there were very different from any other souvenir outlets. I especially am very wary of items that are at the end of the days made in China.

After browsing thru, the little lady who had a very sweet smile attended to us. Later we found out that she was the lady boss. The most interesting this was many of the items were hand made by her. Each item was slightly different even though they were replicas of the other items.

The items were all of very high quality and to have a comparison, the prices are easily 50% cheaper than what your would get in Hanoi.

I would highly recommend this place as it is unique and you would not be able to find the same items elsewhere.

column6:
Deafcraft 5 Colors provides employment for people in the Vietnamese community are deaf. This enables them to live independent lives. They create unique hangdmade cards, bookmarks, magnets, mobiles and Nativty scenes. The detail is exceptional. You will not regret visiting one of the street vendors and supporting this company.

There is a main factory or three street stall locations in Hanoi that you can visit.

The cards and gifts have a superior level of detail. We found it easy to communicate with Dat, even though he was deaf. His pop up shop is at the beginning of Ly Quoc Su. There are also pip up shops at Hang strong Street and Dinh Tien Hong Street.

column4: 5 Hoang Dieu, Hội An 51000 Việt Nam
column6:
I went to just over 20 shoe stores in Hoi An trying to get a very specific pair of shoes made (see picture... they’re from a YouTube video called Russian funk overload) not a single store could make them, they all immediately turned me away. Every single store I went to outsources everything and the people working don’t actually know how to make the shoes so I was always told “no it’s not possible” ...

I had given up hope and was on my way back to my hostel. Right near the western entrance of old town (by the giant sign where the 3 streets converge) I walked past a dark shop with tons of shoes outside and thought why not I’ll give it a try... I showed the lady the picture and right away she told me of course she could make them, no problem. She took my foot measurements and copies of the pictures of the shoes. I thought they were going to be terrible but I didn’t care because I was essentially making them as a joke. 2 days later I stop by the shop and try them on. They fit perfect, they’re super comfy, and they’re absolutely amazing (and rediculous... which they are supposed to be). They were perfect. This lady knows how to make shoes... everyone should be going to her she makes them herself in her little shop with no lights and she does an amazing job. They only cost $60 and considering no one else would even attemp making them I’d say that’s pretty inexpensive.

column6:
We visited this place during our recent HCMC trip. Taking Grab from our hotel, the journey took about 10mins (across the river via bridge) and reach this new mall! It's huge with several storeys but with only a handful of shops, cafes and restaurants operating like Watson, Miniso etc.

The key anchor is Emart, that occupies the ground floor. It's a hypermarket and on the day of our visit, it was crowded despite being a weekday, possibly because it was the eve of Christmas Eve and locals were doing their last minute shopping.

Like Carrefour or Giant, it's huge and sells a wide array of products ranging from groceries to cooked food, household, lifestyle, electrical and fashion related just to name a few. They have weekly promotions and prices were comparable to other supermarkets like AEON which we visited the day before.

We spent a couple of hours here and grabbing some local foods before heading back to our hotel in District 1.

column6: We discovered this place totally by accident. We did not intend on purchasing shoes while in Hoi An but after meeting the team at Lang Man Romantic Shoe Shop, my wife and two children (7 and 10 years old) were persuaded! We got 4 pairs of custom made shoes for around $30USD on average a pair, which I thought was reasonable, but we didn't shop around so I am not sure. We chose the style from what seemed like thousands of choices and chose the leather style and colour from another thousand choices! We paid first, which I was originally worried about, and returned the next day to find all of the team there to greet us while we each tried on our brand-new shoes. column6: Spotted this by chance and was very glad I did. I am a UK size 16 and 5'10" so clothes shopping in South East Asia is difficult. Equally I am backpacking so the idea of getting tailor made clothes that I will destroy is somewhat off putting. However the standard 'tourist clothes' neither look that good, fit well and most importantly don't last more than about a month on me. Thus my need for some better clothes. The owner (I think) was very nice here, not pushy but helpful in finding stuff which would actually fit me. I was at the larger end of his clothing range however UK sizes 14 (so US 12 and Auz 16) and below sould have plenty of choice. Women's clothes only but a range of trousers, tops, skirts, and mainly dresses. The trousers I got were 250000 D each and the dress was 350000 D (with the prices labelled). Which as I saw similar dresses for 800000 D seems pretty good. The clothing appears to be well made with nice fabric (the dress was 50%cotton and 50%silk, the trousers 100% cotton), though time will tell how long they will survive the intended abuse they will suffer. Most the clothing was of the smart casual type so probably something there for most occasions. Also, despite the name, though there were lots of embroidery (which he did in the shop), many pieces didn't have any on if that's not your style. Well worth a visit in any case if you're in Hanoi and easily located near Hoan Kiem Lake and St Joseph Cathedral.

column6: I was excited to be able to get some custom made sandals, belts and a wallet but was not happy with the overall outcome. First, the shoes were to short after they made them. Also, she told me that they could modify the shoes to my liking during the selling process but then changed it after I made my payment and said - “well, if they can’t modify it like you want, we will keep it the same as the one I tried on. She knew all along they couldn’t modify it but told me what I wanted to hear in order to get the sale. Then she said that they could take the scratches out of the belts or give me new ones. Neither happened. Unfortunately they had me come back so late to get the finished products that they couldn’t change anything then and I was leaving very early the next morning- which she knew and I think why she had me come back so late. I would recommend that you go to another place that won’t tell you what you want to hear just to get a sale.

column4: 45 Đường 5, Thảo Điền, Quận 2, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh 70000 Việt Nam
column6:
Tracy Decor
In Ho Chi Minh City, in Vietnam, Tracy Decor is simply the best interior designer,
and that for about 8 years already.
Unsurprisingly, I can only favorably recommend their services.

Having decorated some of the best known «in-restaurants» and bars in town,
their main activity is interior decoration and furniture for houses and apartments,
from nice upper-end to super luxury. You will never get things done that fast.
Nor will You be able find all the stuff they can, the lamps, carpets and curtains
that they can find with a phone call, You will spend days, and still not get what
You wanted, and certainly never for the price they get. So to sum it up, if You
are looking to re-decorate Your existing home, partially or completely, or to fully decorate Your new house or apartment in Vietnam, I can only recommend
Tracy Decor in the highest possible terms.

column6: Habe hier versucht Anzugschuhe maßschneidern zu lassen. Füße wurden ordentlich vermessen und ein passendes Model gefunden. Es war auch eine große Auswahl an verschiedenen Ledern vorhanden. Ich habe noch einige Wünsche geäußert, besonders eine 3/4 Naht der Sohle wurde gewünscht und zugesagt. Ich habe mich morgens vermessen lassen und die Schuhe sollten schon Abends fertig sein. Als ich die Schuhe am Abend abholen wollte waren diese aber noch nicht fertig. Ich sollte also am nächsten Morgen vorbeikommen. Die Schuhe waren am nächsten Morgen fertig, aber viel zu klein. Auch nach einer Wartezeit von 3h in denen die Schuhe geweitet werden sollten waren beide Schuhe weiterhin zu klein. Den linken Schuh konnte ich selbst barfuß nicht ohne Schmerzen tragen. Die Verkäuferin meinte dann der Schuh würde sich noch weiten und das wäre alles kein Problem. Außerdem wäre meine falsche Fußform schuld. Der Schuh sei deswegen gar nicht für meinen Fuß geeignet. Fazit: Schuhe nach Maß bekommt man hier nicht, sondern Schuhe von der Stange in verschiedenen Lederfarben. In meinem Fall, viel zu klein. Leider hatte ich im Voraus bezalt, denn es ließ sich keine Lösung finden. Ich habe jetzt zwei Schuhe, die viel zu klein sind. Kann den Laden überhaupt nicht empfehlen.
column7: Số 510 trên 620 Mua sắm ở Hội An

column4: 72 Hàng Gà, Quận Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 10000 Việt Nam
column6:
I'm a businessman from America, travelling in Hanoi. I had heard that tailors in the area would make custom suits, and seeing many well dressed Vietnamese and Chinese around the city, I was inclined to believe the rumors and seek out a good tailor for a fair price.

I had a Vietnamese speaking guide, who took me around to several shops. I know a lot of work goes into making a custom suit, and that a skilled tailor should be compensated well, but at the same time I wanted to get a fair price that was reflective of the local market - not the "tourist" price.

I ended up at a small shop named Nguyen Nam. I It is located on 72 Hang Ga street. The owner is a middle aged distinguished looking gentlemen, whom I presume is Mr. Nguyen himself. (He dressed like a golfer - and sure enough - proudly displayed a picture of himself on the greens. His handicap is a +7, not bad, especially as gold is a relatively new sport in Vietnam, and he'd only been playing a year. But I digress...)

I sat down with his female staff and looked at several hardcover fashion books, displaying the latest trends. They also brought out a laptop, with image files of famous actors in suits - Daniel Craig, Brad Pitt, Leo DiCaprio, George Clooney - they all made an appearance. Once I'd settled on the type of suit I wanted (two button, modern fit, slim breasted, shorter coat, no cuffs on the pants), I picked the material. As with most tailor shops, Mr. Nguyen had his materials hanging on the wall, and I stood in front of a mirror and had my guide take pictures as he held up each material to my body to see which color was the best. (Note: as I am slightly color blind, and the natural light in Hanoi can be lacking during the cloudy season, my guide offered to take a picture of me on her phone; it gave me a much better idea of the coloring of the fabric against my skin than the fluorescent shop lights.)

Finally, I picked the fabric: a deep blue. He quoted me the price, and I attempted a weak counter offer, but Mr. Nguyen was firm - $380. (I could have probably bargained him down, but I have no backbone for hard negotiations, and I rationalized his price as a better deal than a custom suit in the US, although I probably would have ordered two suits if he had offered a discount to $300 a suit.) I also decided on a second suit jacket of a different color and less expensive material, that he quoted me at $160, all in all I paid around $540 for a custom suit plus extra jacket. He said he would have them ready in five days, but that I would have to come back in two days to test the fit.

Well, I went back last night to test the fit, again with my guide. Everything looked marvelous. I had him give me a little extra room in the legs and shoulders - I'm a largish man, at 6'2" and 212lbs, and I didn't want to burst the seams on my new custom suit. However, I was so pleased with his work, I ordered a second suit, this time in black. Now that he had my measurements, he said he could have it ready at the same time as my other suits. All told, I dropped almost $900, for two custom suits and a blazer. While expensive, I look at it as an investment that will last for the next 3-5 years, and will pay off in spades as "perception is reality" in the business world, and the reality is, Mr. Nguyen's suits look and feel great.

Final thoughts:

- Bring a cell phone with a currency converter, so you can make sure you are paying a fair price.
- Hire a translator or guide. It makes a huge difference! But don't assume that just because the shop owner chooses to speak to your translator in Vietnamese, that they don't understand English. Be careful what you say: always be respectful, this is their profession, and they are very proud of it.
- Be extremely specific about what you want. Don't leave anything open to interpretation. Once you purchase a custom suit, it's pretty hard to come back to get it altered, if you aren't living in Hanoi or make frequent visits.

column6:
Nha trang is famous for swift bird. There are 2 places on Nha trang which you can see them. One is the Swift bird island and this one is called " Nha Yen " (Swift bird house).
It was called " Nha yen "because the bird came to make nest and live here naturally.
The bird leave to find food early in the morning (5-6am) and return to the house at (5-6pm).
The house provide a free entrance to introduce you about the bird house, the product ... but only in Vietnamese, so you should go with a local or a tour guide for translation. The staffs also provide a small cup of tea which made of the bird nest (after cooking).
The bird nest is good for your health and you can buy it here as a gift for your friends and famliy.

column4: 87 Hang Gai Str, Hà Nội 10000 Việt Nam
column6: We spent considerable time trying to locate a store that had laquerware and figurines that were better than Vanloi's, and we couldn't find anything. We stopped at several stores near our hotel, the Sheraton, and also at stores enroute to Ha Long Bay. Vanloi's selection and quality for what we were looking for, at least, were unmatched. The prices were not crazy expensive, either. Vanloi sells a lot of beautiful laquerware trays, decorative boxes and containers, and figures, mostly wood, some ceramic, as well as fantastic large furniture pieces--wardrobes, chests, and so on, all very nicely made. I see the other review that mentioned shipping issues. Vanloi actually helped us assemble a large box, which then fit into another box (double box, a good idea!), and we packed everything carefully and checked the box as second luggage on our return flights home; the two airlines we used, SIA and Asiana, had no issue with it. If I ever went back to Vietnam, I would definitely shop Vanloi. In fact, we are going to order some items from them because we wish we'd bought more.
column7: Số 330 trên 525 Mua sắm ở Hà Nội

column6:
We have known Leo at Thu Thuy for almost ten years now having booked trips and bought many custom-made clothes from him on our various trips to Vietnam. The clothes included suits, shorts, dresses, jackets, and shirts, all of which were good quality at a great price. Although you can buy cheap suits now in Australia they are off the rack and never fit as good as custom-made clothes.

As the other reviewer here notes, Leo’s English is very good which makes for fewer misunderstandings, which happen often in Vietnam! That then leaves you little time to correct if you are not in town for long or will cost you extra money to fix. If it’s a mix-up with tours then you may miss out altogether and get no refund.

Although Leo operates out of a little shop, he can arrange or make almost anything you want and goes out of his way to ensure you are happy with his services and products. Unfortunately he does not have a website, nor does he promote his services in any way so it’s all word of mouth.

However, he does tour the streets of Cua Dai Beach on his motorbike at various times drumming up business with tourists. You may run into him if you're eating dinner at one of the many local cafes in Cua Dai Beach: you'll know it’s him as he has one eye which turns out a touch. I’m sure Leo won’t mind me saying that as he says it makes him distinctive!

column6:
Persoonlijk vind ik onderhandelen erg lastig en ongemakkelijk, maar omdat ik telkens dezelfde jas tegen kwam die me erg aansprak qua model waagde ik me toch een winkel in. Deze winkel had namelijk het model, maar dan zonder de knoopjes op de sluiting. Passen ging met weinig enthousiasme, wel in woorden, maar het straalde er niet vanaf. Kleur kiezen, voering etc. Ze proberen redelijk met je mee te praten. Maar er straalde weinig echte vriendelijkheid vanaf. Met het onderhandelen ging het niet anders. Maar moet gezegd dus ook niet mijn sterkste punt. Maar het ging zoals ons eerder was verteld, als je wegloopt roepen ze je alsnog terug als je niet hebt ondergeboden. Toch probeerden ze er nog een paar dollar bij te kletsen. En uiteindelijk met het omrekenen naar Dong ( ik had geen dollars om mee te betalen) bleek ik achteraf toch nog een 1 dollar meer te hebben betaald. Dat heb ik zo gelaten. De volgende middag terug om te passen! De beide dames keken nog steeds niet erg vriendelijk. Er kon geen lachje vanaf. De jas was klaar. Maat was prima! Keurig afgewerkt. Wel kleine oneffenheid aan de binnenkant bij de voering. Verder super leuk om zo je jas te laten maken op kleur!
Ik had een deel betaald, en betaalde nu het laatste deel. Kreeg ik te weinig wisselgeld terug. Deed ze heel moeilijk over. Werd voor mij meer een principe kwestie. Toen kwam er toch 5000 en uiteindelijk ook nog de resterende 3000. Toen ik daarna wegging en vriendelijk bedankte en lachte, kwam er een miniem lachje terug.
column7: Số 526 trên 620 Mua sắm ở Hội An

column4: 92 Nguyễn Hữu Cảnh 4 D7 Saigon Pearl Villa, Bình Thạnh, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh 700000 Việt Nam
column6:
Visited SIR Tailor many months back when they were at their old location. I’ve tailored at many different places - particularly in Singapore and in Hong Kong (Sam’s Tailors/WW Chan). So here’s the good and the bad: when I compare SIR against the other tailors that I have patronised. Unfortunately SIR is the only Vietnamese tailor that I have visited, so I can’t say for the other tailors.

Good
===
1. I think tailoring (or at least premium style ones) is still at its infancy stage in Vietnam so SIR is about educating the masses.
2. Clothes were on time - they promised 1 week for shirts to be delivered.
3. I only visited once to choose the fabrics and get my measurements done - they were excellent - that I won’t deny.

Bad
===
1. Expensive when it comes to the “premium” fabrics, premium in this case relates solely to Thomas Mason fabrics. Perhaps the label of TM should be affixed to the shirt for authenticity purposes.
2. Limited range of fabrics - you get a lot of local/Chinese fabrics off unbranded fabric swatches books. - perhaps the need to look at getting Soktas etc.
3. Overseas shipping incurs hefty charges - other tailors would gladly ship for free. No tracking number too.
4. The old location was a bit small but I hear they have since moved - so maybe that’s a bad point that has now changed to good.
5. Service was a bit slow - they took a while to serve - they was another American couple there at the same time who seemed a bit impatient.

I was recently in Hanoi and brought a top and dress. Once I returned to the US and tried my dress on for the first time, the entire elastic around the shoulders snapped and the dress immediately fell down to my waist. The dress is not wearable, it is completely broken at the top as the elastic is not holding up.

A friend I was traveling with also bought a different dress from this store and the strap broke the first night she wore it. We were still in Hanoi at the time and I believe the store did exchange it for her.

I reached out to request a refund since I’m not able to return or exchange in person and the store declined.

I wouldn’t recommend this maker. Check trip adviser reviews first before committing!

VietNam's Delights is a chain of shops selling Vietnamese and produce from many other countries. Such as Cola from the US and Nestle from France.

The prices are exorbitant and the service is terrible.

At VD at NoiBai (Hanoi) international airport, foreigners are charged 98,000 Dong for 2 small CocaColas that usually cost 20,000 Dong.

Yes, I understand that things cost more at airports. But 5 times more is a ripoff.

When I said "Oh my god! Really 98k?" the staff and I had a great laugh. They know it is a ridiculous ripoff.

Summary: Stay away

column6: This was the first shop we visited in Hoi An and the owner was very nice to us and promised us that this was the cheapest and best place to shop and have shirts made/tailored. But this soon turned out to be a NIGHTMARE! This was without a doubt the most expensive place we had clothing (primarily shirts) made and the service was terrible. Nothing was done in time and never according to our wishes. The staff there was also calling us names in vietnamese (they didn't know that I understood vietnamese). So making 2 shirts took us 3 days with argueing and on the last day the owner threatened to call the police since we didn't want to pay the remaining 50% of the price for what we had ordered. With this treath in mind we paid for the shirts even though the quality and tailoring was bad, so that we could continue on our beach vacation. I have never in all of my years of travelling had such a bad experience in a shop ever. So if you read this review please stay away!

column6:
Честно говоря, не понравилось. Дело в том, что обратился к ним в связи с поломкой мобильного телефона. Показал телефон. В ответ - сделаем! Ну, сделали. Вроде работает. Заплатил, ушел.
Но через 30 минут мобильник "умер" насовсем. Возвращаться и ругаться не стал. Дома отнес телефон в ремонт - сообщили, что вьетнамский мастер просто соединил там что-то "напрямую". кое-как отремонтировали. Причем в нашей мастерской за ремонт взяли меньше.
Что касается электроники, которая продается на этой точке - выбор есть. Но что либо покупать у них, после ремонта, уже не захотелось.

column6:
Middelmådigt sted

Kvinden som jeg bestilte min kjole ved virkede sur og deprimeret. Derudover blev hun nærmest fornærmet da jeg forhandlede pris med hende, og fortalte mig at penge havde høj betydning for hende, men ikke for mig, uden at vide hvad jeg tjener (som studerende). Det er ikke en måde at drive forretning på.

Grunden til jeg så valgte at gå med denne skrædder var fordi de ikke havde det stof i den farve jeg ønskede hos det andet sted som jeg fik lavet en masse tøj hos (blandt andet to silkekjole for 40 og 45 USD). Hos Thinh Thanh ville hun havde 45 USD for en bomuldskjole. Jeg fik den ned på 38$.

Kjolen jeg har fået lavet er smuk. Jeg er spændt på at få den brugt, for at se hvordan kvaliteten af stoffet er.

Kvinden ved navn Three som var i butikken da jeg hentede kjolen virkede rigtig sød og hjælpsom.

column6: What a nightmare. Commissioned the tailor to make a custom blazer. There are no costs to be saved with this tailor about 20% higher than a high end commercial blazer. Blazer was to be charcoal grey with a Airborne maroon interior. What was presented to me was a dull gray blazer with a death black interior. The most hideous garment I’ve ever seen. I explained that this was not what I had ordered or paid for. A thousand excuses and sorry it’s full price. The jacket went straight to the garbage I’m out 400. Only a discount or partial refund offered after negative reviews. Do not waste your time or money with this very colourful character
column7: Số 2 trong 3 hoạt động giải trí tại Tay Ho

column6: TIENDA CON UNOS PRECIOS DE ATRACO. Entre por que me gusto las cosas que tenían, por cierto nada estaba marcado con el precio, compre dos collares de seda que pague a 500.000 dong cada uno, después de haberme descontado 100.000 de cada, pero mi sorpresa y sobre todo enfado fue cuando encuentro otra tienda (ArtBook) con mas cosas y muchas iguales y los mismos collares no solo valían un 50% menos sino que tenían muchos mas colores y todo lo que vendían estaba marcado con el precio. Al día siguiente volví a la tienda para decírselo a la dueña y enseñarle las fotos que había hecho con los precios, ni se inmuto incluso le dije que se los devolvía y claro a eso dijo que no. Lo que si le advertí es que iba a escribir una opinión en Tripadvisor de su tienda.

column6: SHOCKINGLY BAD LEATHER PRODUCT MAKERS, the older rude Vietnamese woman in the shop wanted payment before making anything, I gave her way over what I should have paid (advised by 3 local Vietnamese friends that she had ripped me off!) for a wallet, the card section did not work for slotting cards in, plus bad, uneven stitching, then the glasses case which was flimsy not suitable for protecting glasses and button hole warped stretched leather, then the bag (OH MY!) tacky, badly stitched with glue left around the stitching! All the products were terribly made, and no refund was given even after asking and going into the shop to get the products fixed, nothing was fixed and handed back to me. The worst part was she PUSHED and HIT ME when I asked her for a refund! I was totally shocked! I could not believe a person would do this, how unstable, violent, and aggressive this woman was, she took no responsibility for hitting and pushing me, or even give me a partial refund for badly made items! DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THIS SHOP, THEY ARE LIARS, THEFTS, AGGRESSIVE AND UNSTABLE! I was told by several people in Hoi An that they would not use B199, as they charge way over what should be charged, unfortunately I trusted them. I'm getting my story out and letting people know not to go in, many better and honest shops around Hoi An. This woman is a disgrace to Vietnam.

column6: My Mom bought 4 sculptures here when she came back to Vietnam and visited Da Nang. She was told that the shipping fee to OUR HOME ( in Arlington, TX) was $100, the shop owner showed my mom a price list for the fees and she paid for everything including shipping and purchasing, around $1,300.Months later, a company called CSLL Logistics located in Cali contacted me asking for $668 including regulation fee and customs clearance (as they claimed) then they will release the cargo. And if I want to have it shipped to my house, I have to pay extra $450. THIS IS A FRAUD!!!!! Don't come here, don't let them get your hard earn money in an easy way

column6: I should have read the reviews first! I chose a beautiful fabric and negotiated a price with the tailor which was on the high side. She insisted I pay the whole amount up front. Two days later she called me and said I had to come back to the store and pick another fabric as she didn’t have the one I had picked. I had to change my plans for the day to travel back to the store and pick an inferior fabric to the one I had paid for. Despite returning for three more fittings and adjustments the suit pants were miles too big and I had to have them taken in when I got home to Australia. The woman was also very rude to my brother and demanded he pay an extra $30 (US) on top of what he had already paid for a jacket because she said the buttons were too expensive. My sister also had four fittings for her dress and it still wasn’t right and had to pay for it to be fixed in Hoi An. Quality of workmanship is the only good thing I can say unfortunately.
